venue.address_1: parking lot (park on left side)---intersection of thoreau and walden streets
venue.name: hapgood-wright town forest

item.description:
The 800 acres known as Cutler Park comprise the largest remaining fresh water marsh on the middle Charles River. These marshlands and ponds attract over 100 species of bird.

Parking is located on Kendrick street, between 3rd and 4th avenues. Kendrick street in Needham begins where Nahanton street in Newton ends.

Please dress for the occasion, including sturdy, water-repellant boots (or even waterproof if you're interested in poking aroung the rim of those marshes). There are boardwalks provided, but I cannot guarantee there won't be spots that may have experienced mild submergence (This will be my first visit as well, and Spring can be a soggy season.). Plus, the wonderous charm of this environment may beckon us off the beaten path.

Also bring binoculars, magnifying glasses, field guides, and other provisions so that you may adequately scrutinize and comprehend the glories of our natural world.
item.how_to_find_us: my vehicle: red jeep with big wheels
item.name: Cutler Park: Journey Through The Marshlands
